<color=#fff>Destroys an item, creating a random number of Affix Shards containing its powers.

<color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Rerolls the values of all affixes on an item within their tiers.

<color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Removes a random affix on an item, returning a number of shards equal to its tier.

<font="Forum-Regular SDF"><color=#B4AD99>Experimental and Personal affixes cannot be removed this way.</font>

<color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Adds random tier 1 affixes to all empty affix slots on an item. Has an increased chance of rolling rarer affixes.

<font="Forum-Regular SDF"><color=#B4AD99>Does not cost forging potential, but cannot be applied to items with zero forging potential.</font>

<color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Rerolls all implicits on an item.

<color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Changes the item into a unique or set item of the same item type.

Using this on a Silver Ring could turn it into any unique ring, including ones that are not Silver Rings. However it cannot turn it into a Helmet.

None of the other properties of the base item are retained.

<color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Duplicates the item, but reduces the forging potential of both the original and the copy to 0.

<color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Modifies the outcome of a craft, granting it a 25% chance to have no forging potential cost.

<color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Modifies the outcome of a craft when upgrading an affix.

Randomly changes the upgraded affix to a different one that can spawn on that item type. It cannot change a prefix into a suffix or vice versa.

For example if you use a fire resistance shard to a raise the tier of a fire resistance suffix the tier would increase as normal and then it would change into a different affix such as cold resistance or increased health.

<color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Modifies the outcome of a craft when upgrading an affix.

Prevents the roll of an affix within its range changing when it is upgraded.

<color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Has a chance to seal an affix instead of upgrading it. The sealed affix is moved to its own slot, leaving its old slot open for you to add a new affix.<font="Forum-Regular SDF"><color=#B4AD99>

The sealed affix cannot be modified further and an item can have a maximum of one sealed affix.

Chance to seal is higher when crafting on affixes of lower tiers, and is also higher for exalted items and items with more affixes.

</font><color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

Opens the portal to The Arena in Champions' Gate.

Champions' Gate lies to the west of Heoborea past the Wengari Fortress in the Divine Era.

<color=#fff>Right Click to open the Map at Champion's Gate

Opens the portal to The Arena in Champions' Gate.

<color=#fff>Right Click to open the Map at Champion's Gate.</color>

If an Endless Arena run is started with this key it will begin with 100 waves already completed, or half the waves you completed in your previous arena run rounded to the nearest 10, whichever is higher.

Opens the door to the Temporal Sanctum dungeon in the Ruined Coast.

The Ruined Coast can be reached through the time rift behind the door in the eastern cliff face in The Shining Cove. This time rift links the Divine Era version of the cove to the Ruined Era.

<color=#fff>Right Click to open the Map at the Temporal Sanctum.

Opens the door to the Lightless Arbor dungeon beneath the Shrouded Ridge.

The Shrouded Ridge lies to the east of Last Refuge, and can be reached by heading north from where the Sheltered Wood exits out onto the Surface.

<color=#fff>Right Click to open the Map at the Lightless Arbor.

Opens the door to the Soulfire Bastion dungeon in the Felled Wood.

To reach the Felled Wood in the Imperial Era one may head north east from the Risen Lake or north west from the Ruins of Etendell.

<color=#fff>Right Click to open the Map at the Soulfire Bastion.

Studying at the great colleges of Welryn and Vul'Kaur, Vilatria perfected the art of Storm Magic. Yet a scholarly life never sated her ambition and she returned to the Lake kingdoms of central Eterra. Without a god to lead them, their lords and elders were proud and open to challenges of force. With the college of Welryn on their doorsteps, they were not unprepared for arcane challengers, but their wards could not protect them from the lightning that tore threw the roofs of their halls and smote them in their thrones, and so Vilatria claimed their kingdoms by force.

In her old age, Vilatria's hubris only grew. Having defeated all her human challengers, the storm queen's mind turned to Lagon, the fabled god of the sea and storms. With her apprentice, she sailed out from the border town of Etendell, along the estuary and out into the Fogrise sea. Lagon was said to dwell beneath the far seas beyond the western isles, yet the journey was quick for Vilatria as she fuelled her sails with winds of magic. Eventually she alighted at night upon a great isle of rock, coral, and ancient shrines. The moon spoke to her from its reflection flickering on the surface of the sea. It spoke with the voice of Lagon, and it spoke with amusement at her challenge, readily accepting, and opening the heavens. Thousands of years have passed and Vilatria is long dead, and her kingdom fractured, but the storms still rage upon the seas around that isle.

Each stack of Maelstrom grants [3,4,2] Ward per second
+[150,220,3]% Ward Retention for 6 seconds when you Transform
Whether wrapped in shadows, barriers, blessings, or armor, the storm reduced them to ash.
When you directly cast Elemental Nova 6 times without a 2 second gap, the 6th cast gains [200,350,3]% increased area and +[40,100,4] Spell Damage
One of seven enchanted rings that were all believed to be lost when Atlaria vanished beneath the waves.
10% less Damage Taken if you have at least 180 Total Attributes
Once light fades, only darkness can guide those who remain.

Fascinated by mirages, Telf'un long wandered the deserts, telescope in hand. Even after decades of study and delirium he failed to truly comprehend their nature, but eventually the mirages took pity on the old man and turned him into one of their own.
18% increased Movement Speed while not Channelling
You throw an axe at a nearby enemy every second while channelling Warpath
"By Rahyeh's will this town shall burn!"
[26,42,1]% More Fire Damage to enemies afflicted by Spreading Flames

The witches of the Red Marsh learned to cultivate a type of magical fungus within their own skulls. The mycelium grew eagerly into their brains, twisting their minds, but the powers it bestowed were well worth their sanity.
+[17,29,0] Poison Damage for Damage Over Time Spells
A precise and expertly crafted tool for cutting a soul from a body
[36,61,1]% Increased Area for Infernal Shade and for your Summoned Wraiths' Melee Attacks
[11,16,2]% Chance to Cast Summon Wraith when you or one of your Wraiths kills an enemy
[22,36, 3]% Chance to Cast Infernal Shade when you or one of your Wraiths kills an enemy
+[61,66,5] Necrotic Damage for Damage Over Time Spells

Jelkhor was once the greatest archer and artificer in all of Majasa's domain. Eventually the diamond matrons grew fearful of his popularity among the human populace, and so they accused him of a terrible crime and had his left hand severed, so that he could no longer wield a bow. Though disgraced and outcast, Jelkhor's resolve remained and his ingenuity gave him the tools he needed to deliver his revenge.
Detonating Arrow no longer requires a bow

Detonating Arrow's initial projectile is changed to a melee attack that applies an explosive charge to each enemy it hits. Each charge explodes after the same duration that an arrow from Detonating Arrow would, and the explosion deals the same damage.
Detonating Arrow scales with melee damage instead of bow damage
When the scholars of Vul'Kaur realised the artifact's power, they shattered it immediately and told not even Majasa of their discovery.
[65,125,1]% more Damage for Spark Charges applied by Melee Attacks
When you cast Teleport you apply a Spark Charge to all enemies around the destination
Above the skies the natural and the arcane are one.
The streets of Maj'elka engender no love for authority
"The gods serve only themselves, foolish mortals. They will not protect you. If you wish to survive, you must forge your own sanctuary."
Health Leech is disabled for 4 seconds when you directly cast a Spell
The mercenary guilds of Skalnir care naught for the destruction they leave in their wake, as long as their pay is fair and they can take a cut of the spoils.

Formosus knew not what cause these warriors had fought for, or what ancient conflict left their bodies frozen upon the outer ice. But, as he felt the rage and power of their lingering souls he knew well what purpose they would now fulfill.
When a Minion dies you gain a stack of Frozen Vengeance

When you Hit an enemy with a melee attack you expend a stack of Frozen Vengeance to grant all your minions Frenzy and 24% more Damage to Chilled Enemies for 8 seconds and Freeze up to 8 nearby normal and magic enemies for 3 seconds
[24,38,3]% chance for Minions to Chill Attackers when Hit
+3 to Cold and Necrotic Minion Skills
Minions deal [14,24,2]% more Cold and Necrotic Damage to Chilled Enemies
"Cities, memories, whole timelines have been erased by the spreading void. There is much work ahead of us."- The Acolyte of Golden Silk
"For those who have lost everything, The Weaver's bounty knows no end."- The Acolyte of Golden Silk
"Rest now, you are safe here in this cocoon. It's all gone now, but this is not where your thread ends."- The Acolyte of Golden Silk
Gain a stack of Golden Aegis each second
Lose a stack of Golden Aegis on Block
"Those long lost may walk again on woven feet"- The Acolyte of Golden Silk
When you gain Haste or refresh its duration you gain [30,60,1] Ward (1 second cooldown) and your Minions gain Haste and Frenzy for 3 Seconds
"A protector of wilds long lost shall now serve a greater purpose"- The Acolyte of Golden Silk
"Such insight wasted on a lost timeline. It is for naught now, but it proves thy worth."- The Acolyte of Golden Silk
Endurance applies to [5,9,0] additional Health per 10 Missing Mana
"Memories of past honour that befits the woven form"- The Acolyte of Golden Silk
"The context of thy aspirations is long lost, yet they still pervade thy silken form."- The Acolyte of Golden Silk
When a nearby enemy or ally dies you gain Ward equal to 2% to [4,6,1]% of its maximum health (2 second cooldown)
"It is no accident that you have outlasted your world, but belief in one's own luck is a powerful tool."- The Acolyte of Golden Silk
1 in 6 chance to take [25,15,1]% less Damage per Active Shadow

In the blackened heart of an emperor, greed devours mercy.
With careful planning and precise instruments, one can bring order even to a flame.
Dark clouds roll in from the Sea of the Storms

"The cycle of life and death is forever shattered. Our cities shall not crumble and our citizens shall not yield or die at the whims of a winged devil. We shall persist. Our bodies may whither and decay, but even when we fall we return and persist again. Glory to the new cycle. Glory to persistence and decay. Glory to humanity."- Thelocus, Imperial Governor of Argentum
+[18,27,0] Poison Damage for your Minions' Damage Over Time Spells
Your Volatile Zombies have a chance to resurrect equal to 100% divided by your Number of Zombies
The carapace of a meruna storm ogre makes for an impressive trophy, and an effective cuirass.

"I have long travelled the north, Aergon. I have seen the great stone ruins at Reimhaven and Kolheim and I have seen the frozen blood of their ancient defenders. No tower can stand forever and those walls shall not avail you when the flames descends. You must strike first."- Reowyn's last letter to the mages of Oerden's Watch.
Fleeing does not stem the flow
In the waning years of his reign Lord Drelkor forbade the mages of Welryn from focusing their studies on any single element, lest their research lead them to aligning with forces beyond his domain.

"Runes provide order to magic, a way to shape it, harness it, and use it for one's will. Follow their structure and you shall remain in control, break it and you shall loose the madness between the lines."- Arch Runemaster Unvar to the college of Kolheim.
Runebolt's element always matches the last skill you used directly that had a single elemental tag

+5 Spell Damage per stack of Numeromancy
5% increased Cast Speed per stack of Numeromancy
"I do not need to mend the wounds that a dead foe had not the chance to inflict"- Elecoe the Alchemist Thief

Chronowarp grants 35% increased cast speed and movement speed
[5,10,1]% increased Cooldown Recovery Speed for Teleport and Transplant
When you cast teleport or transplant you time lock up to 10 enemies around the destination for 1 second. Bosses are slowed instead of time locked.
Carve the burning nightmares into stone
Modifiers to Volcanic Orb speed also apply to Flame Rush speed and distance at [60,64,4]% effectiveness
Increases to Fire Aura Area also apply to Glyph of Dominion

<color=#fff>Seals an experimental affix on the item. The affix is moved to its own slot, leaving its old slot open for you to add a new affix.<font="Forum-Regular SDF"><color=#B4AD99>

The sealed affix cannot be modified further and an item can have a maximum of one sealed affix.

When an experimental affix is sealed you have a chance to gain a Glyph of Insight. This chance is higher for items with higher tier affixes, but cannot exceed 45%.

</font><color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Changes a prefix into an experimental affix.

Only works on gloves, boots, and belts, and does not work if the item already has an experimental affix.<font="Forum-Regular SDF"><color=#B4AD99>

The exact experimental affix it becomes and its tier are determined by the properties of the item.

Which properties determine the affix and what is required for higher tiers can be discerned through experimenting and carefully studying the numbers of the items you experiment on.

</font><color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Seals an experimental affix on the item. The affix is moved to its own slot, leaving its old slot open for you to add a new affix.<font="Forum-Regular SDF"><color=#B4AD99>

The sealed affix cannot be modified further and an item can have a maximum of one sealed affix.

When an experimental affix is sealed you have a chance to gain a Glyph of Insight. This chance is higher for items with higher tier affixes, but cannot exceed 45%.

</font><color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

<color=#fff>Changes a prefix into an experimental affix.

Only works on gloves, boots, and belts, and does not work if the item already has an experimental affix.<font="Forum-Regular SDF"><color=#B4AD99>

The exact experimental affix it becomes and its tier are determined by the properties of the item.

Which properties determine the affix and what is required for higher tiers can be discerned through experimenting and carefully studying the numbers of the items you experiment on.

</font><color=#999>Press [F] to open the Crafting Panel.</color>

Your Intelligence is equal to your Strength
Lightning Blast cast this way has +1% Critical Strike Chance per 5% uncapped Lightning Resistance and +1% Critical Strike Multiplier per 5% uncapped Cold Resistance

While standing on your Glyph of Dominion, 100% of your Ignite Chance is converted to Fire Resistance Shred Chance, 100% of your Chill Chance is converted to Cold Resistance Shred Chance, and 100% of your Shock Chance is converted to Lightning Resistance Shred Chance.
[39,52,0]% increased Duration of Ignite, Chill, Shock, Fire Resistance Shred, Cold Resistance Shred, and Lightning Resistance Shred.

"The city is lost. All remaining garrisons are to head north. The great roots and ancient wards of Farwood shall be our last stronghold against the horde. And, Heorot Willing, it will be their tomb."- Arch Cryomancer Frey, Champion of Heorot.
When you directly cast Frost Wall it is cast directly in front of you and you leap backwards a short distance and invoke Revik's Blizzard at the wall.
After you directly cast a One Rune Invocation you gain Dawn to Dusk
Directly casting a Two Rune Invocation consumes Dawn to Dusk to gain +48 Spell Damage and 24% increased area and grant you Dusk to Midnight
Directly casting a Three Rune Invocation consumes Dusk to Midnight to gain +96 Spell Damage and 48% increased area
Forged by Archmage Drinial for his remaining son, it carries a powerful enchantment to draw out yearning. Now, its wielders unburdened, the sword itself yearns for its shattered kin.
When you shatter a Two Handed Sword while you have Merophage equipped, it absorbs the shards you would gain, using them to gain Legendary affixes or replace its existing ones.
Javelin no longer pierces, but when it hits an enemy it splits into 2 piercing spears that are fired at enemies around the target. 1 Additional spear is created per 12 Dexterity.
Infused with countless potions, its effects are very unpredictable.
A puppet crafted to hold a transient spirit. It seems merely avian in nature, but it's impossible to shake the sense of unease that builds as one looks into those carved black eyes.
The Cuckoo may permanently change into a random exalted item when a nearby enemy dies

Brawl with beer in the brewery and emerge victorious to claim the Brewmaster's Buckle.

A runemaster fortress from which Rune Prisons are temporally displaced, and the arcane experiments they created are sealed away.

Defeat the wardens to lower the barrier around the Thaumaturgy Device and craft your own experimental items.

Time travel between the abandoned tower in the Divine Era and the refortified Lich's abode in the Imperial Era.

Defeat both the Osprix and Imperial forces to control the Relic of the Oberserver and alter the fate of your items. The Relic allows you to swap between strength, intelligence, dexterity, and attunement affixes on your items.
A Cemetery of the Erased where woven echoes can be exchanged for others, once the Woven Firstborn has been slain.
Delve into a vast Tomb of the Erased and defeat the Fateweavers to claim the echo specific rewards of all surrounding echoes.
Descend into a labyrinthine Tomb of the Erased and defeat the Ascendant Firstborn to weave new Tombs of the Erased into all surrounding echoes.

Duel a Harbinger that has already slain the boss of this timeline, and claim its spoils.

It drops the same items as it would have had you slain it right after defeating the timeline boss.

Travel to the brink of the black hole, to the end of all timelines that Orobyss has erased. There confront a sequence of Harbingers who have slain the bosses of those timelines and reclaim the treasures they stole.
Charge the Great Beacon in this echo to reveal echoes in a large area around it.

Before he vanished, the Barnacle King stashed his treasure in a hidden vault deep beneath the ground. Search for the lost vault within the caverns and altruistically free the overburdened lizards locked within the caches.

Venture into the eastern fortress long since broken and defiled by the Harbingers. Disturb the remains of its defenders to confront the Void Nemesis and destroy it.

Completing this echo permanently adds the void nemesis to the pool of nemeses you may encounter and improves the chance for rare and exalted items' affixes to become exalted when empowering a nemesis.
Complete the objective to claim loot fit for a great Primalist.
Complete the objective to claim loot fit for a great Mage.
Complete the objective to claim loot fit for a great Sentinel.
Complete the objective to claim loot fit for a great Acolyte.
Complete the objective to claim loot fit for a great Rogue.
You have 50% less armor while channeling Focus
20% increased range with Firebrand and Puncture
Block Chance is converted to Parry Chance while not wielding a shield
Max 8 stacks. Dual wielding this weapon affects the amount of stacks gained.
Gain a stack of Kismet when you directly use a melee attack and hit at least one enemy
When you use a throwing attack, consume all stacks of Kismet to gain +8% throwing critical strike chance and +8 throwing physical damage per stack

Defend the turtle of enormous girth as it transports the Transmuting Gem.

Once the attackers are defeated you can harness the gem's power to reweave the fate of your unique items that have legendary potential, either increasing it or decreasing it. The new legendary potential is rolled the same way as the legendary potential of a freshly dropped unique of that type. As such, for most uniques it is mostly likely to change the legendary potential to 0.
